ns0:entry.ns0:title: Biomechanical analysis based on a full-body musculoskeletal model for evaluating the effect of a passive lower-limb exoskeleton on lumbar load
ns0:entry.ns0:summary: The present study investigated the effect of a passive lower-limb exoskeleton on lumbar load and verified the effectiveness of biomechanical analysis for evaluating the physical burden while wearing the exoskeleton. Twelve healthy male participants performed an assembly task under three conditions: standing and high and low sitting while wearing the exoskeleton. We mainly analyzed the joint compression force computed using the musculoskeletal model based on measurements obtained from a motion capture system and force platform. While wearing the exoskeleton, the lumbar joint compression force increased. Analysis of the joint compression force can determine the increase in the lumbar load when wearing an exoskeleton, which is not possible using the traditional analysis of posture and muscular activity. Therefore, biomechanical analysis based on a full-body musculoskeletal model provides valuable information in evaluating the effect of the exoskeleton that attempts to prevent musculoskeletal disorders.
